description: This waymarked circular walk explores the Mendips Hills, visiting several pretty villages and their classic pubs. The 47 mile trail forms a loop around the AONB, extending to Bleadon Hill in the west. It begins at Hinton Blewett in the east and passes through Priddy, Cheddar, Axbridge, Bleadon (its western end), Rowberrow, and Compton Martin. The trail comprises six sections connecting six Butcombe pubs: The Ring O Bells in Hinton Blewett, The Queen Victoria, The Lamb, The Queens Arms, The Swan, and The Ring O Bells in Compton Martin. These sections can be completed in any order. The trail is also used as a challenging ultramarathon route.
